title: "MODERN" Typeface? (ahh, the irony...)
content:
Forgive this typographic nightmare, but does anyone have an idea of what typeface the word “Modern” is in?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/picture-1_5370.jpg)

I’m also looking for faces that might be similar.

 [‹ Youth Against](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/typophile.com/node/42838 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need to find this font urgent! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/typophile.com/node/42836 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fmcausby

comments.content: Gill Sans Extra bold ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gill-sans/extra-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gill-sans/extra-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gill-sans/extra-bold/")) is similar... at least, it feels similar. The Hard points remind me of Bureau Eagle Bold ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/eagle/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/eagle/bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/eagle/bold/")), but it’s not that clunky. The “E” just gives me a headache. Ick.

Yeah, Eagle Bold is about the closest I’ve come. After doing a little research I also found [Kobalt Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5KT), and [Bovine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080308200024/http:/www.identifont.com/show?6A1). Gill Sans Extra Bold is the first thing I thought of, too, although the “m” and “n” feel more like Eagle.
I think it’s Gill, but with a modified or redrawn M and N.
